current_fears: Starting a student organization and studying abroad
current_challenges: Freezing up during a presentation for the student org
current_behaviors: Attending networking events and office hours
current_anxiety_triggers: Career fairs and big networking events

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Fear of judgment/rejection when pitching student org ideas, 2) Presentation anxiety in leadership roles, 3) Imposter syndrome about leading the org, 4) Isolation concerns with study abroad. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Testing the org idea casually with 2-3 classmates over coffee, 2) Using bullet points for presentations and practicing, 3) Recruiting a co-founder for the org, 4) Requesting a buddy system and pre-departure meetups for study abroad. Student's response to solutions: Positive, agreed to text friends and email study abroad office, expressed gratitude for the support. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student has clear action items (texting friends, emailing study abroad office) and feels more confident about taking small steps.
